main event: A student at Princeton University observed a silver, stationary object hovering in the sky on March 31, 1953.
interesting points: The object was about 30 feet in diameter and appeared to be made of aluminum or silver-colored metal,It hovered silently and motionlessly for approximately 15-30 minutes,The observer described the object as not being any type of conventional aircraft,The object seemed to be intelligently controlled despite no visible occupants,The sighting was later analyzed alongside other reports and determined to be unusual.
